content.raw:
I definitely agree that a name change is needed with that file and/or plugin.

When I first wrote the mock plugin, I wasn’t sure how big it would become in future PRs as we add more features to test. When it came time to write the Frame Semantics test, I decided it would be better to have separate plugin libraries for each plugin concept that we’re trying to test, so I created a separate plugin specifically for testing Frame Semantics.

Since this plugin is mostly about testing the retrieval of Entities, what if we call it something like `test/plugins/MockEntities.cc` and then the plugin itself can be renamed to something like `mock::EntitiesPlugin`?
content.html:
I definitely agree that a name change is needed with that file and/or plugin.

When I first wrote the mock plugin, I wasn’t sure how big it would become in future PRs as we add more features to test. When it came time to write the Frame Semantics test, I decided it would be better to have separate plugin libraries for each plugin concept that we’re trying to test, so I created a separate plugin specifically for testing Frame Semantics.

Since this plugin is mostly about testing the retrieval of Entities, what if we call it something like test/plugins/MockEntities.cc and then the plugin itself can be renamed to something like mock::EntitiesPlugin?
